comments.body:
They should maybe drop a new type of feather? Crafted with normal feathers and blaze powder?
Ignited feathers? 
It could be something used for, for example, creating new stronger arrows?
They should only have 1head
this is a cool way for piglins to go after more things
How about instead of dropping normal feathers the dropped Phoenix feathers that could be used for making your elytra give you particles of fire?

I like this idea over all.

I like that it would give piglins more prey and that it would make the nether more dangerous.

I would say change the appearance. Two heads especially would probably just look tacky.

Also, are they parrot sized, phantom sized, dragon sized, or something in between? I would suggest phantom sized.
I think this would scare kids, but it would be interesting to see this monster in minecraft.

I must say that this idea is interesting, but the most striking thing is the fact of placing reptiles in the nether, since they are cold blooded and need heat, it would be interesting to see this in minecraft.
I like it but it should spawn in crimson forests with hoglins so people aren't being constantly attacked by them. (and because there are enough hostile mobs as is)

네더 도무지 갈곳이 못되구요 네더사마귀 하나 구하자고 이곳저곳을 돌아다녀봤지만 얻지도 못합니다

네더 난이도를 하향시키던지 네더사마귀블록을 네더 사마귀로 바꿀수 있게 하던지 해주십쇼 갔다만 하면 자꾸 죽고 요새같은것도 하나가 발견되면 다른요새는 안나옵니다

I want to see more life in the Nether. This should be added along with the fury. I think this creature needs a different name but the overall concept is good. It should spawn in the crimson forest and it won't attack you unless you attack it. It also needs a better reward. Maybe you could make lizard stew or use it's tongue as a grappling hook, or something like that.
It would be nice if they dropped fire charges, I wouldn't vote otherwise, if a mob doesn't have some small use for a player (with some exceptions) the players will hate them.
Already suggested.
it should drop pure FIRE
Great mob idea and good idea for a drop. They can be lava proof and maybe be able to swim through lava too
Maybe they would follow the same naming convention as the Endermite. Nethermite sounds more like something that would be in Minecraft.
Hi
I think this would be a good addition, it adds more preperation for a nether fortress.
I think, based on the name, they should infest magma blocks, but that's just me
Was this from the AntVenom video?
I definitely want tame able rabbits, they could be little cute pets and you could be able to make hutches that they would stay in.

Definitely want this! The fox trusting is perfect for bunnies, you still get wild skittish buns and get to make a lovely bunny sanctuary : ) The constant teleporting of tameable pets would be pretty unnecessary.
This would also be useful for making bundles, as they're crafted with rabbit hides.
It would be nice to have a pet rabbit that didn't fear me
It would be cool to be able to tame them too

Welcome to the feedback site! We love seeing unique suggestions for a "first go" at things and recommend if you're looking for ways to point people to your suggestion, using one of the handy buttons available:
@Nova Why, thank you, good sir.

This is a great idea! I think it should be terrestrial. maybe a special swamp varient or structure for were it spawns, and maybe each head has a different function, one summons skeletons, one breaths splash potions of poison, and the last one just keeps you at bay?

I love this concept. The idea of there being a fully Overworld boss other than the Elder Guardians (and technically they're not even a boss in the same sense that the Ender Dragon and Wither are since you don't need to really summon them or go through any real boss battle process) is just awesome to me. I would really like to see this idea come to life in Minecraft for real.
The idea is great. But in my opinion it is better that Hydra could be summoned.

I think it should spawn in special biome hydra swamp or mutated swamp.
I also think it should have less health like maybe 80 (40 hearts) per a head
Should have poison bite not breath
My son Logan, also came up with this idea. He asked to have them add a "Ender Hydra" mob. He described a 3 headed Ender dragon. Might I add mounting one of these would be AWESOME.
Spirits should only be able to be attacked with potions and magic like the potion of harming.

I could see that being reasonable.  The main way of killing them and other immune creatures is with a staff or a spelled weapon, but potion damage would be another way to do it, albeit less convenient.

In mythology Wyverns are frequently seen with a poisonous barb on their tail. Have you considered adding one to your Wyverns or do you feel it wouldn't fit the feel your going for?

Also what if witches could spawn on the backs of wyverns? Since there is very little chance of mojang adding broomsticks anytime soon this is most sertainly the next best thing in my opinion. Would also be cool if witches could pull out a witch dagger the way vindicator pulls out an axe. Just a thought.

Finally I was looking at the taming method. I like the idea you came up with but I also feel just holding a gold ingot is a cheaty way to disable the Wyvern. Considering how easy it is to come across gold in the overworld. It would remove their fear factor. One possible idea is they could have nests that you could attempt to rob. Raising the egg as your own, letting the baby Wyvern imprint on you.

Those are just a few ideas I thought I'd throw out there. I absolutely love the idea of the mythos dimension. I do hope to see it added in game. Especially the wyverns. You don't know how hard it actually is to try to add them through add-ons until you've tried for yourself. The parrot doesn't have a walking animation and the bat never stops flapping unless it's hanging upside down. We definitely need a land+air mob.

Whew! Need to take a breath. Again Love the idea! Hope to see it added. Good luck! You have my vote!
Love the Wyvern idea! They are all the buzz today! Hopefully Mojang jumps on the bandwagon!
o.O  I didn't realize that wyverns were especially popular recently.  I just wanted to add the "rideable dragon" that people keep asking for without it being a copy of the Ender Dragon. x3

I've actually never heard of wyverns having a poisonous barb.  I'm not sure that would fit.

Witches (the hostile overworld mob) aren't a thing in Mythos, and Wyverns aren't going to spawn in the overworld, so I don't think that Witches mounted on Wyverns would make sense.  The Good Witches of Mythos wouldn't use the tainted Wyvern as a mount either.

I'm honestly not very good at coming up with creative taming methods (I ended up giving up with the Unicorn, after all xP ).  So I would not mind if the devs or someone else came up with something better.  The gold method could also be less overpowered, such as holding gold could only give you a short reprieve and a Wyvern that has been given gold is only mollified for a short time so that the taming would be more dangerous.
I would like to see a witch design...
This is the first time I've thought of unicorns as a workable mob. Great job!
has anyone here ever played ark survival evolved
They should be able to do though portals and to to the end on your first time but sometimes they help the Dragon even if tamed because they are kin but giving them a good ingot stops the behaviour.
Personally, i dont want this to be an update. If these mobs are added, i think it will feel to much like a fantasy game, or an rpg
Yes please! the creators should know about this!
Yes me and my freinds had this idea

YYYYYEEEESSSSSSSSS!!!! THE DRAGON EGG IS SO USELESS!! It should be tamed though with chorus fruit and grows to an adult like that. They should have armor and saddles. They can be hatched in some “Royal type of grand way” that is still associated with the end and should be hatched with some fire like dragons are supposed to hatch like. I don’t know if they should have their own eggs or something but if yes, it should be rare.
Agreed. We need that.
We need minecraft to add this.

yeah, there used to be a debate on whether they should add "red dragons" and "water dragons" the red dragon would be less dangerous than an ender dragon and the water dragon would guard the ocean monument, if bred together they would create a baby ender dragon. (so cute!!!!!!! <3)

and i voted for this and i followed it to sooooo
Love the design!
This concept is amazing and I would love to see it in game! Maybe pillager outposts could have them in cages similar to what they do with iron golems.

This post doesn't have near enough the amount of votes that it should. I mean, who wouldn't want to ride a ravager!? Also, it does mention on Minecraft.net that ravagers are cow-like creatures, so a woolly ravager would make a lot of sense. Love the idea fellow human, you have my vote!
I think this is a great idea they could be found in raids but only in snowy villages you could also shear them getting 4-10 wool but it stays sheared for ever (like the mooshroom).
I think they should spawn in place of ravagers in snowy village raids and the same should be true with iceologers replacing evokers
Maybe there could sometimes be ravager/wooly ravager stables as a rare spawn next to Outposts. Could rarely have chest that contain a rabbits foot, or saddles. Awesome idea, this should be added!
This is underrated, a cool idea!!! This should have more votes let's spread the idea!!!
I don't understand why people are not voting for it it's a masterpiece
I hate to think that this only has a few votes..
I love this!

• Magma Monster -> This would be a Boss that only spawns in the nether. It would be abit rarer than a Nether Fortress to find and it only appears in Lava Lakes. The Way you would know that it's home you'd see a giant Nether rack cave with lava going into it where he would appear and try to kill you. This Boss would drop an Item which you'd be able to craft an Enchantment book or A Type of armor that makes you resistant to Fire/Lava.

 

  • The Mooshroom King -> This is a boss that would be a Minotaur type of boss that uses a sword or axe and is really fast and is Giant. He/She would also have small versions of it self called Miniontaur that would protect the way into it's Boss Arena. This would be a really rare boss that has 10% chance of spawning in a Mushroom Biome. It's Home would be kind of like a maze and puzzle to get into it's Boss. The Miniontaurs would be protecting the way into the boss room.(Yes this is inspired by the Twilight Boss) This boss would drop a really rare item that is identical to the Trident but would be like a Tomahawk Diamond Axe which you would also be able to summon 2 miniontaurs with by right clicking on the ground and using in a fight. (The Summoned Miniontaurs would not be as powerful as the miniontaurs that exist in the Boss Arena)

The Ice Yeti -> The Ice Yeti would be two times as large as the Player and would throw blue ice blocks at the player and would drop it's fur which you would be able to make armour out of that would be a like the Golden Armour but with more durability. This Boss shouldn't be too rare as it's drops wouldn't be the best. -> This Boss would only be found in the Ice Biome in a big mountain of ice.

 

Thank you for reading through my Suggestion and I really hope The Development Team at Mojang considers what I've said in these posts. Minecraft is about the Adventure & Adding something new to the adventure aspect of the game would be truly amazing.

Moved to proper category.

Thanks for your contribution.

I have a idea fore a boss! A mushroom king! By the name it seems obvious that is would spawn on mushroom islands. A special drop could be legendary mushroom stew. The effects of the stew could be regen for 30 seconds, and it fills 3\4 of your hunger bar.

Maybe a qeen bee that drops a stinger that can be made into a sword that poisons and is better than iron sword and it can also drop honey seeds and it can drop its crown that make you do 2times as much damage and 2times as much speed

• Pillager King -  Someone has to be leading the pillagers, right? The Pillager King could be a heavily armored swordsman, wielding an enchanted sword. The Pillager King will call upon other pillagers to defend him, along with ravagers. To get the Pillager King to spawn, you would need to have the max level for Bad Omen. On the final wave of the highest level raid, the Pillager King will spawn in. While trying to defeat the Pillager King, you will still need to defend the village from pillagers, and the Pillager King. If the player is able to kill the Pillager King, they player will be rewarded either the Pillager King's weapon, or one of their pieces of armor (all with 'Curse of Vanishing').

  • Mummified Pharaoh - The Pharaoh would spawn in a larger updated desert temple. Inside the temple, there would be a chance to find the Pharaoh's tomb. The player, upon opening looting any chest, would trigger the Pharaoh to spawn in the tomb (small boss arena). The Pharaoh would use summoning (summoning husks), inflict blindness, and poison the player with his gold sword. Upon death of the Pharaoh, the player would have the chance to claim the poisonous gold sword (Pharaoh's Sword), that would have 'Curse of Vanishing'. They player could also receive alternative loot as a drop as well. 

 

All weapon/armor drops would be custom and would have Curse of Vanishing applied to them.

I don't like the Totem of Dying mechanics you described, but the genera idea is good. Maybe the Totem of Dying could be added to your sword in an anvil for a special enchantment called Withering which affects the mobs you hit with Wither III. I could go with the effects you described if there was something in there like what I described.

Also, I thought the zombified Illagers could possibly have the same built-in armor as a zombie does (2 points) in addition to their normal health.

By the way, I designed some zombie Illager textures a while ago and posted them on PlanetMinecraft, the link is here. You can use these, but make sure to give me credit if you do.

This makes sense, there is no biological difference we know of between them, other hostile mobs should attack them, or at least be deterred by the illager beast as an explanation for why there not bothered.

This is a pretty rad idea as illagers are the only non-undead mobs that can use weapons I’m pretty sure, which means this mechanic could lead to cool battles. Also this could mean you could find infested outposts and mansions just like with infested villages

Idea is awesome!
but totem of Dying is... no, it’s stupid
I think that zombie vindicators and pillagers should just be like zombies but with more damage, while evokers, illlusioners, and witches should have unique spells.
Great idea dude!

Another thing illagers should do is also attack zombies and other undead mobs, but don't forget about the pillager, the newer variant of Illager. The zombie illager spawned from this would hold a crossbow and use it like it's living counterpart. Also for texture ideas, they should reuse the zombie villager texture and model, but make the eyebrows look like the illagers, and the appearance vary depending on which type of illager was zombified. Vindicator zombies should have vindicator outfits, evokers have evoker outfits, and so on.

I would rather say that zombies and their variant should attack illagers just like other humanoids, but about zombie illagers, that means if one of the illagers dies while fighting zombie hoard then turned into a zombie illager, the illagers basically kill their own kin. I'm not sure about the zombie idea, but zombies attack illagers is a definite okay
Witches. Villagers. Pillagers. Evokers. Vindicators. And now Zombie Pillagers. My head hurts.

I like that idea I hope this gets implemented. they can drop what they usually drop including the normal zombie drops. but I don't like the totem of dying though. They could have the same wepeons and heath, like the witch could use poitions to attack and help other zombies. And the evoker could use his magic. And you could witness a patrol fighting zombies. Good idea 👍
I hope you like this idea, I poured my heart and soul into it. Once again, I really hope it makes it into the game. I will adjust whatever needs to be adjusted.

The idea is interesting, but I fear that you would basically get annihilated by endermen every time a peeper is activated.  And shulkers might not be incredibly dangerous, but you can still be killed by them if you aren't careful enough.

@ClayGoddessSari:

I've thought about this, and I'm considering nerfing it slightly. I just need to think of how to nerf it.

@WolveReigner781

I'm working on a design now.

 

Thank you for your feedback.
UPDATE: Design added! (NOT FINAL, this is only to show a basic idea of what it would look like.)
looks good, but a couple flaws. but eyy, nothings perfect. you have my support.
@SummerDogDawson Thanks for the feedback!  I'm working on a big update to this idea in a short while, so stay tuned. ;)
Our end is safe! 😹
MASSIVE UPDATE! I've taken the time to modify the peeper in a way that makes it interesting. If there's anything wrong with the new version, just let me know!
You Should change the name from Peeper to The Stalker because it looks like an eye
The peeper is so cute! I really liked the model, and the overall idea too.
MOUNTAINEER FTW!!!
it lost the vote to glow squid, and there would be too many new mobs.
A reminder that the ICEOLOGER lost the 2020 vote, the Mountaineer is a completely different mob

Instead of spawning randomly, Mountaineers should be found in a unique mountain structure that is akin to the Ramparts secret mission in Minecraft Dungeons. Essentially a stone fortress in the mountains with Pillagers, Vindicators, Mountaineers, and Iceologers on the outside roof area. This would fit more inline with other Illagers who aren't found outside their structures or specific patrolling groups. You could also add the Mountaineering pick as a reward for going into this structure, and you'd use it for traversal as the Mountaineers do.
Great idea! I love axolotl but maybe there light level could be higher.
Mojang doesn't want to add dynamic lighting. That's why the glowsquid doesn't actually glow.
I am all in this idea but how will they glow unlike the glow squid?

Hmm, I thought about this after the green axolotl from Minecon Live was not included in 20w51a, maybe the Green Axolotl could be a rare (not as rare as the Blue Axolotl) variant that has a chance of spawning in a phosphorescent version of the Lush Cave?
Perhaps we could create glowing Axolotls with the glow inksac. And the secondary color of the Axolotls could glow like the glowsquid does

The last time they removed the green axolotl because it was made by scientists, I don't know much about the axolotl, but if the one you are talking about is made by scientists I don't think they add it, but that depends on mojang

Minecraft Make sure you make a new glow axolotl variant the glow light axolotl a passive variant of axolotls that spawn in lush caves mangrove swamps amethyst rainforest lush forest and jungle biomes please add the new glow axolotl variant to the game I'm begging
They should be able to change colors to and be tamed by bugs you can catch by a net or by hand!
Renewable sand seems like a very important thing to be added to Minecraft
Sand could also be made with stone and water. Perhaps placing certain blocks under running water turns floating stone blocks into sand. Terracotta could make red sand.
Or husks drop sand was an idea proposed by scicraft
Yes! Imagine how easy making giant glass buildings in hardcore series would be! No more grinding, just zombiefieing and curing a villlager.
include some tindet glass and thats perfect
Yes this would be amazing and make so much since, we're gonna need reliable horses if we're gonna live in the nether!

I think skeleton horses should also be immune to the effects of soul sand. They should also spawn in packs of four to five with skeletons(with potentially armor on them either gold or leather) on them that use the horses to hunt down the players that are slowed down by the soul sand and soul fire. Wanting to have a form of faster transportation would give the player more of a reason to travel to soul sand valley. But it clearly won’t be easy to get it, seeing as the player will have to go through quite a fight.
Good idea, but no fire resistance.
Love it. Soul sand valleys are nearly impossible to navigate on foot, so this would be a great addition.
What if the skeleton horsemen who spawn in the overworked during a lightning storm also spawned in the soul sand Vally.
Excess formatting removed.
Can the horses go back to the way they used to look like

I don't know where else to really put this, but since it's horse related I've come here. Is there a possibility horses can go back to how they originally were, when they looked like Mo's creatures horses. They had more depth and didn't look as bad. I used to use horses a tone more before the update because I couldn't get around without feeling off because f the designs. They looked better how they used to appear, legs with two sections, head flat and not with a drop at the muzzle, legs, once again, extended outward subtly in order to show depth, rearing, the opening and closing of the mouth. The armour makes them look bad as well now with the new models, and I've seen a lot of People on LogDotZip's channel in the horse comparison video that greatly miss the old models probably just as much as myself and a large portion of the minecraft community. (I apologize for the length of this but it really does irritate me how they downgraded horses just to up textures and stats, but I'd prefer the old ones over the new ones any day.)

Hey there!

I've been playing Minecraft for two months already and I've actually discovered many things which really impressed me a lot. Honestly, my favourite place to settle down in Minecraft is a village. I've been exploring quite a lot these last two days and moreover I've come across some new villages not that far away from my first one. Thanks to their proximity, I've also noticed that I can reach all those villages easily by foot, but I've seen that there are some worthy ways I could use to move to. I've tried riding a horse these days, but it's not something so worthy as I was thinking. Since these villages are located next to mountains or rivers, I've been becoming aware of the fact that a horse can't really cross a high mountain or just a river. Wish they could overstep them!

Don't know if you ever experienced something like that before. What should I do to solve somehow this issue? Should I modify the route or is there an easy way I might use to have a nice ride with my horse? I'd be more than glad to hear from you some advices! :)
Peacocks are too obscure.
Peacocks would make a beautiful and very worthy mob entry! They are visually incredible, and dropped feathers would allow for cool crafting opportunities.
I don't think you should be able to ride them but instead have them as pets
This would honestly be perfect for the Plains biome since other biomes are each getting their own unique mobs.
I feel as if the feed it seeds idea is used for both parrots and chickens so it has to be a different bird maybe
I feel as if the feed it seeds idea is used for both parrots and chickens so it has to be a different bird maybe but the idea does sound cool
Peacocks are way too small to ride in real life. The only birds actually big enough to ride are ostriches and other birds like that. Peacocks are only about as big as turkeys.
I feel like they would be a beautiful addition to the bamboo forests <3 And there could even be a rare albino peacock spawn!

I wanted to add Peacock and make it useful in that way:

Peacock only spawns in plain area of jungles or in Sunflower plains, they always spawn in pairs: a peacock and a peahen. Peacocks dance with open feathers during rain.

Uses, drops and effects: Peacocks eat seeds like chicken, when killed, peahens drop peafowl egg and feather, which we can use to hatch nad tame a peacock, and Peacocks can drop three peacock feathers when killed and 6 peacock feathers when sheared.
We can use it to make a Peacock staff by one breeze rod, one blaze rod and three peacock feather in a line, If we hit any mob with the staff, the mob will follow you for 10 minutes, it not works for ender dragon, warden and wither, But Staff will break after 20 times, one can keep it long lasting using unbreaking and mending enchantments. We can use Peacock feather with Elytra to reduce Crash landing damage, slow falling effect... Types...

Why would a snake fly but its a funny idea so i agree!
Luigimarinusvlogs it’s an actual snake in real life. It doesn’t actually fly. It glides.
I think Phantoms are enough of a Pain to deal with

It should be when you get too close rather than when you aren't looking, that way it isn't as annoying. It should be relatively rare and drop scales which can be used to brew potions, make a new banner pattern, and decorate armor.
That's a good idea
By 'rare' do you mean, drowned rare, dungeon rare, or charged creeper rare.
First of all, I think drowned should be more common. Anyway, I'm not too sure. They definitely shouldn't be as rare as charged creepers (I've never encountered one) Like as rare as witches.
Other hostile water mobs would be better in any case but the reason I want the guardians to spawn in the oceans is to make them more useful. Instead of them being a one time sight.
Maybe there should be a new abyss biome where guardians spawn?
Wow, this is a really good idea!

This has been a consistent problem lately. Goats give useless goat horns, glow squids give useless ink sacs. These mobs and votes would often end up disappointing. Many players aren't just builders, they play minecraft because of survival mode. They venture to caves to get stronger tools, they kill drowned to get cool tridents, they go to end cities to get shulkers and elytras. They're extrinsically motivated and would like stuff that aid in survival, and if mobs like frogs only give aesthetics, then they won't bother much.

Right now the rascal is giving useless items as well like an iron pick, and I wish that they can give something more unique and exciting.

Many mods like the Aether give cool new weapons and stuff that aid in survival, and bosses and challenges to use those stuff on, to get even better drops. It's not just aesthetics and gimmicks, it's tangible rewards.
It would be great if the plant were given a use, at least. Sniffers already have the purpose of spawning these, no other way to obtain them without this mob.
I would like to make the sniffer have a symbiotic relationship to the player to make it essential to actually work with them as opposed to just mindlessly trapping them in a box to farm seeds.
I'm thinking the sniffer could also be used as a way to find certain biomes or slime chunks, kind of like the natures compass mod.
Sniffers given organic materials can follow their scents to lead to player to the items respective biomes. This is a way to find skulk, slime chunks, coral, others without outside tools.
I really want the sniffer in Minecraft java
Mojang should make different types of sniffers in different byomes

With the sniffer should be adding leaf clover when you plant it sometimes drop four leaf clover (and be rare) you can use it to make luck potion if you drink it you will be having (fortune and looting) with power 1 or 2. I don't speak English, if I have any problem, please correct me

how about the bone fish drop b able to be brewed into a "lava sight potion"

Minecraft, I want the bone fish and wither bone fish to be in the game called Minecraft in the new spring drop 2026 update that will feature a new passive bone fish mob and the new wither bone fish neutral mob that spawns in the lava oceans in the nether including bone fish also bone fish get to spawn in ocean caves lush caves dripstone caves lush forest amethyst rainforest biomes and mangrove swamp biomes as the actual bone fish variant the swampy bone fish and it is also passive towards players

there should be like mountain king (mountain), Mummy pharoah (desert), kraken (ocean), giant venus fly trap (swamp). Frost giant (snow), Giant mosquito (jungle).. there's not enough big encounters in minecraft and slaying the current mobs gets repetitive quick.
I like the idea but how about they only spawn in a certain areas like near lava so they aren't that annoying.
Maybe make them a passive mob because the nether doesnt have any yet, and make them have good loot but be hard to catch
Can you explain more?

When i made this originally it was planned to be completely hostile, but looking back it may be better if its a neutral. The mob will act like any neutral mob flying around you, however when you health gets lower than half health it will start to attack. They fly in groups, and are scared of ghast. Like i said they live in hives or nests on the roof of the nether, when killed maybe they drop glowstone. The ones not near the nest may be found near lava. I hope this information can satisfy.
